channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Gold Slightly Retreats Slightly Amid Profit Taking After Middle-East Risks Drive Demand
item.description: Gold prices edged lower in early European trading amid some profit-taking, after rising in the previous session as fears of an all-out war in the Midd...

item.title: Geopolitical Risk Premium to Oil Is Still Moderate, Goldman Says
item.description: Oil gained, but the geopolitical risk premium to prices is still modest, despite escalating tensions in the Middle East, Goldman Sachs said.

item.title: Nike Needs Time to Get Off the Sidelines
item.description: The apparel giant’s new CEO might have to lower expectations further before starting a turnaround.

item.title: ‘I believe she made a big mistake’: My wife put her paycheck into a bank account with her inheritance. Do I now own 50% of those funds?
item.description: “I’m still working, and we’ve always filed joint tax returns.”

item.title: Medicare’s open-enrollment season will be tricky. Here’s how to make smart choices.
item.description: Read plan details carefully, and expect changes to prices and coverage.

item.title: ‘This money is not bringing me a lot of happiness’: My husband and I have $7 million, but our kids are trouble. Should we cut them off?
item.description: “His son and his wife are not good to us. We rarely see them and they never offer to help us with anything.”

item.title: A CVS Breakup Is No Easy Fix for Its Problems
item.description: Splitting up the company would face challenges, but there is no perfect solution to its struggles.

item.title: Dollar Might Rise on Potential Trump Victory But Not For Long
item.description: The dollar might rise initially if Trump wins the election with a clean sweep of Congress, but the currency’s potential gains probably wouldn’t prove ...

item.title: LPL Financial’s stock falls in premarket after it fires its CEO
item.description: LPL Financial Holdings Inc.’s stock was down 4.7% in premarket trading on Wednesday after it said it fired Dan H. Arnold as chief executive for allege...

item.title: Mortgage rates tick up for the first time in 3 months
item.description: Mortgage applications fell 1.3% in the past week, the Mortgage Bankers Association said.
